formulas.title: Formula (extracted text)
formulas.raw: Using tabulated values (BS 7671 Appendix 4): Single-phase and three-phase with tabulated mV/A/m: Inline: \( \Delta V = \dfrac{mV\!/\!A\!/\!m \times I_b \times L}{1000} \) Block: \[ \Delta V = \frac{k \cdot I_b \cdot L}{1000} \] where \(k\) is the tabulated voltage-drop factor in mV/A/m appropriate to the circuit type. Percentage voltage drop: \[ \Delta V_{\%} = \frac{\Delta V}{V_n} \times 100 \] Maximum allowable length for a given limit \(p\%\): \[ L_{\max} = \frac{\left(\frac{p}{100} \cdot V_n\right) \cdot 1000}{k \cdot I_b} \] General formulation with resistance and reactance (reference): Single-phase: \( \Delta V = I \cdot (R \cos\varphi + X \sin\varphi) \cdot L \) Three-phase: \( \Delta V = \sqrt{3} \cdot I \cdot (R \cos\varphi + X \sin\varphi) \cdot L \)
